During the hearing, Senator Sherrod Brown (D-OH), the committee‚Äôs chairman, asked Powell about the risks posed by crypto assets and how the Fed is evaluating the risks of crypto-related activities by its supervised institutions.

How This Hacker Was Rewarded After Returning Tender.fi‚Äôs Stolen Funds
entry.summary:
The Tender.fi¬† ‚Äúwhite hat‚Äù hacker accused of withdrawing over $1.59 million from the Arbitrum-based decentralized finance (DeFi) lending protocol has returned the funds. A few days ago, the platform suspended lending services while attempting to recover these assets.¬†
Web3 smart contract auditor CertiK focused on blockchain monitoring, and analytics firm Lookonchain conducted an investigation. These firms traced the hacker who committed the crime after discovering a ‚Äúmisconfiguration‚Äù on Tender.fi‚Äôs Oracle.
White Hat Hacker Rewarded By Tender.fi¬†

Report: Perth Mint Faces $9 Billion Recall From China Over ‚ÄòDoped‚Äô Gold Scandal
entry.summary:
Perth Mint, Australia‚Äôs official bullion mint, currently faces a $9 billion recall from China for allegedly selling ‚Äúdoped‚Äù bullion and attempting to cover it up, as reported by Australia‚Äôs ABC News. The practice of doping gold involves adding impure ore like silver to the mix to cut costs and lower the quality of gold. Reportedly, Perth Mint started diluting the gold it issues in 2018. The report covered by ABC states that some refinery staff identified more impure ores being added than what‚Äôs allowed by the Shanghai Gold Exchange (SGE).
Allegations of Gold Dilution and Cover-Up at Perth Mint
Perth Mint is in the spotlight this week due to a report by Australia‚Äôs ABC News correspondents Angus Grigg, Ali Russell, Stephanie Zillman, and Meghna Bali, accusing Australia‚Äôs official bullion‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin Mining And Green Energy: How Sustainable Is BTC Network Today?
entry.summary:
The Bitcoin mining network has been gradually transitioning towards green energy. Here‚Äôs how much percentage of the network is sustainable today.
52.6% Of The Bitcoin Mining Network Is Now Using Sustainable Energy
One of the most talked about controversies around cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin has been their potential negative impact on the environment. BTC uses a ‚Äúproof-of-work‚Äù (PoW) consensus system to validate transactions on the blockchain. This means that chain validators called miners compete against each other using vast amounts of computing power to be the first to solve a mathematical puzzle and get to set transfers in the next block.
Miners require specialized computing units for this purpose which can be power-hungry. As the Bitcoin network has only grown larger over the y‚Ä¶

entry.title: Algorand-Based Wallet Provider MyAlgo Reports Security Breach Again
entry.summary:
Crypto exchange Algodex and wallet provider MyAlgo have undergone multiple security breaches over the past few weeks. Today, MyAlgo has issued another warning stating that users should withdraw their funds as the recent security breach has not been tackled yet.
Through a tweet, Algodex stated that a malicious actor had infiltrated one corporate wallet just two days ago. According to the crypto exchange Algodex, this ‚Äúseems similar to what is happening in the Algorand ecosystem right now.‚Äù
Before the attack, the crypto exchange had taken precautions, which included moving a considerable volume of its stablecoins and native Algodex (ALGX) tokens to a secure platform. The leaked wallet was tied to Algodex‚Äôs liquidity rewards program, providing extra liquidity to the ALGX token.

entry.summary:
Hut 8 Mining, one of North America‚Äôs largest digital asset miners, released its February production figures on Tuesday, reporting an 8% decline in BTC production. However, the company said it plans to sell the 156 BTC mined during the month to fund its operating costs.

Jaime Leverton, Hut 8‚Äôs Chief Executive Officer, noted in a statement that the company opted to sell a portion of its stack instead of ‚Äúseeking other financing options with less attractive terms.‚Äù Last month, the company also sold the 188 BTC it mined earlier in January 2023.

entry.title: Silver Proponent Predicts Medium-to-Long-Term Prices of $125 Per Ounce Thanks to Auto Industry

Silver prices have been hovering just below the $21 per troy ounce mark over the last 24 hours, after jumping above the $24 range in mid-January. While long-term and modest forecasts expect silver to hit $30 by 2025 and $40 by 2027, Keith Neumeyer, CEO of First Majestic Silver, thinks medium to long-term, silver could reach $125 per ounce, thanks to the automobile industry.
Keith Neumeyer Highlights Silver‚Äôs Role in the Growing Demand for Renewable Energy and Electric Vehicles
The precious metal silver is down more than 12% against the U.S. dollar since mid-January when it reached $24 per troy ounce. Still, six-month statistics show an ounce of silver is 14% higher than it was on September 6, 2022. According to the forecast on coinpriceforecast.com recorded on March 6, 2023, silver‚Äôs p‚Ä¶

entry.title: Jack Dorsey‚Äôs Block Announces Mining Development Kit For Novel Bitcoin Mining Use Cases
entry.summary:
The development kit is envisioned as having multiple components that would enable increase the accessibility and openness of bitcoin mining hardware. Jack Dorsey‚Äôs Block has posted a new blog that details the Mining Development Kit, a new project that would seemingly replicate the Lightning Development Kit and Bitcoin Development Kit projects, providing developers access to bitcoin mining projects focused on integrating bitcoin mining into various novel use cases. The blog describes how the company has started developing their own bitcoin mining semiconductor chips, saying that ‚ÄúThese purpose-built application specific integrated circuits (ASICs) are the leading way bitcoin is mined today and will serve as the foundation for a full suite of bitcoin mining products intended to increase the pace of innovation in bitcoin mining.‚Äù Block then says it is considering building the MDK, and they are seeking further feedback from the community. The MDK as Block ‚Äúcurrently envisions it‚Äù would have four components:
A ‚Äúpowerful, reliable, industrial-grade‚Äù bitcoin mining hashboard. A custom controller board designed to work with the hashboard. Open-source firmware, a software API and a web front-end, that would allow developers to modify the key performance parameters of the hashboard. And extensive reference materials and support documentation ‚Äúto facilitate easy customization of the hashboard.‚Äù
‚ÄúThe intention behind the MDK is to provide developers with a suite of tools to help unlock creativity and innovation in bitcoin mining hardware,‚Äù describes the blog. ‚ÄúWith the MDK, we see a significant opportunity to increase the accessibility and openness of bitcoin mining hardware, in order to accelerate innovation in the field.‚Äù The post ends with a promise of future updates in the coming weeks and months, and a call to action for feedback that can be directed to mining@block.xyz.

entry.title: Argo Blockchain Continues To Increase Bitcoin Mining, Outpacing Difficulty Growth
entry.summary:
The crypto market remains in the bear zone, even after several months. In the last week, major coins, such as Bitcoin and Ethereum have seen a decline; for¬†now, it‚Äôs impossible to determine the outcome in the nearest future.
But certain firms are still thriving amid the current state of the market. A notable example is Argo, a popular UK-based Bitcoin mining company. Argo Blockchain is one of the leading cryptocurrency mining companies in North America and Europe.
Argo Increases Bitcoin Production
On Tuesday, Argo announced an increase in its Bitcoin production despite the increased difficulty when it comes to mining the coin. The company reported producing 162 BTC in February, a 7% daily increase from the previous month.
According to Argo, this increase in production results from ‚Ä¶

entry.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse

He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in ‚ÄúSnow Crash,‚Äù goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. entry.summary: French electronic music producer DJ Agoria told Decrypt's Dan Roberts what excites him most about music NFTs, how it informs his work as a generative artist, and why Web3 is all about artists exploring "new ideas that were not possible in Web2."

entry.title: How Adidas Jumped Into Web3 and What It Plans Next
entry.summary: Adidas Web3 lead Erika Wykes-Sneyd told Decrypt's Dan Roberts the story of what prompted Adidas to get into crypto (it involves Elon Musk), what the brand has done so far with NFTs tied to physical apparel, and what it's considering next‚Äîincluding token-gated sneaker drops.

entry.title: Why 160-Year-Old Luxury Watch Maker Panerai Is Getting into NFTs
entry.summary: Eva Assayag, Web3 lead at Panerai, sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about Panerai's Web3 strategy, which will soon include a "digital passport" sold with every watch.

entry.title: NFT Factory President: 'NFTs Will Be Active in a Bull or Bear Market'
entry.summary: John Karp, president of NFT Factory Paris and the founder of Non-Fungible Conference Lisbon, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about the exploding Web3 community in Paris, the concept behind creating a physical gallery for NFTs, and how the existing art community understands NFTs because "everybody understands art."

entry.title: What Attracted Artist Tom Sachs to NFTs? Community and Identity
entry.summary: Tom Sachs is a conceptual artist whose work has been displayed in museums and galleries all over the world, but he told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris he never before felt part of an art movement‚Äîuntil he got into NFTs and Web3. He talked about Rocket Factory and the pull of Web3 art communities.

entry.title: Arianee CEO: Big Consumer Brands Are Going to Take Web3 to 1 Billion Users
entry.summary: Pierre-Nicolas Hurstel, CEO of Arianee, which offers enterprise software to consumer brands to help them launch NFTs tied to physical goods, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how much the NFT space is growing despite the bear market, how big consumer brands will take crypto mainstream, and how loyalty programs are going to be the next huge use case for NFTs.

entry.title: Salesforce Web3 Lead: Every Brand's Web Site Will Support Crypto Wallets
entry.summary: Salesforce's Web3 lead Marc Mathieu sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about the CRM giant's crypto strategy, why "we had to" embrace Web3, and why the crypto wallet is "the new cookie" online.

entry.title: Doodles CEO: Why In-Person Meetups Are Crucial for NFT Communities
entry.summary: Doodles CEO Julian Holguin, former president of Billboard, sat down with Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris to talk about the strong vibes at the event and the importance of IRL meetups in Web3, what's next for Doodles and the community, and his prediction that many newer projects won't survive the crypto winter.

entry.title: SuperRare Co-Founder: We Remain Committed to NFT Artist Royalties
entry.summary: SuperRare co-founder Jon Perkins sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about the debate over artist royalties, SuperRare's roots in catering to artists, and building through a bear market.

entry.title: gm: Meet the Brain Behind Avalanche
entry.summary: Avalanche founder and Ava Labs CEO Emin Gun Sirer has been working on proof-of-work cryptocurrencies since before Bitcoin (seriously). He talked to Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott about how Avalanche avoided FTX and how much damage SBF has done to crypto‚Äôs image with VCs, why institutions still aren‚Äôt backing away from crypto, why Avalanche will succeed in the long run, and trying to cater to both Wall Street institutions and DeFi degens. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Founder of The Sandbox: 'Essential' to Metaverse That Users Own Their Digital Content
entry.summary: Sebastien Borget, founder and COO of the metaverse realm The Sandbox, sat down wit Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris to talk about the future of the open metaverse and true digital ownership, what's next for The Sandbox, and its current user numbers and stats.

entry.title: Playboy's Next Step in Web3: MetaMansion in The Sandbox
entry.summary: Playboy's Web3 lead Liz Suman sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to tell the story of how the 70-year-old magazine brand got into Web3 and preview its upcoming MetaMansion in The Sandbox, which will give special access privileges to those with a Playboy Rabbitar NFT.
